undo - cats do not belong on parent and child. Pick one or the other

/* Criticism by former members of purported cults */ move key term out of piped link
/* Dictionary definitions of "cult" */ rv attempt to turn the Cult master article into a pejorative POV diatribe against cults
why does this article discuss the full range of meanings of the term when it is ostebsibly only about the pejorative usage? we have [[cult (disambiguation)]] for other meanings.
/* Theories about joining */ fix pointless split
maybe you should discuss this - two editors have now said the same thing that the two should be separated.
/* Theories about joining */ Hadden uses "NRM " to include both cults and sects
undo - please read more carefully before changing - cults also mentioned later in section
/* Theories about joining */ separate using subheaders
rename heading to cover all instances
/* Theories about joining cults and NRMs */ there are differences between the two reasonings and should be separated

/* Other controversial groups */ deleted a section of uncited comments against mormons
/* Genuine concerns and exaggerations about "cults" */ trimming redundant material (this is all above, other than the fairly clear [[OR on how Christian science is perceived)
/* Study of cults */ rm POV "alleged"s - "cults" exist by definition so prefixing "alleged" is usually a POV conceptual attack; properly used, "alleged" prefixes unproved legal charges.
/* Theories about joining cults and NRMs */ rv "idea" to "concept" - unless Stark-Bainbridge referred to "conversion" as an "idea", then properly it's a well-established "concept"; rm "alleged" POVs
/* Theories about joining alleged cults */ clarity
/* Theories about joining alleged cults */ sp., organizing
/* Theories about joining alleged cults */ summarizing Langone

/* Alleged cults, NRMs, and the sociology and psychology of religion */ trimming large amounts of redundancy
